intro: Strobilanthes aspera, commonly known as the rough strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually rough to the touch, giving it its common name. The flowers are often arranged in spikes and can produce small, attractive blooms that attract pollinators.
